reasoning: Bilateral cryptorchidism is a congenital condition with prevalence measured at birth. Estimated ~2.5% of male births globally show bilateral undescended testicles, approximately 10-15% of all cryptorchidism cases. Reported as prevalence rather than incidence since this is a congenital developmental condition with clear presence at birth.
source: Bosniak MA et al. (2001). Cryptorchidism and its association with nomalignant disease: A brief literature review. Int J Urol. 8:S57-S63; WHO reports on congenital anomalies (2003-2005)
